thread.title: SamDimmer published Keith Vaz delivers his general election victory speech after...

author: SamDimmer
title: SamDimmer published Keith Vaz delivers his general election victory speech after...
text:
Keith Vaz delivers his general election victory speech after increasing Leicester East majority By SamDimmer   0 COMMENTS SHARES 
Keith Vaz hit out at Theresa May and praised his Labour Party colleagues after increasing his majority to remain as Labour MP for Leicester West. 
The long-standing MP, first elected in 1987, won more votes than ever before, and now commands a huge majority of more than 22,000. 
Mr Vaz paid tribute to party colleagues on the city council, including elected mayor Sir Peter Soulsby for upholding Labour values in the city and helping to ensure tonight's successes. 
Read more: Labour's Keith Vaz holds Leicester East in 2017 general election 
He added: "If Theresa May does not increase the number of seats for the Conservative Party then I think she would have to consider her position, as would any sitting Prime Minister." 
Mr Vaz added that the national result would also have a significant impact on the pending Brexit negotiations.
